Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it would be the other way around for purchasing things. use channels CC so the store knows it can collect the funds, regardless of if the chain is reorged or not

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so there can be instant payments that are irrevocable instantly

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: normal payments subject to the reorg rules

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and these cancellable payments, which are not final until enough time passes

Author: NutellaLicka#4241

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Well, launching an independent chain on Komodo is very simple. So if you have the team with the necessary skills you can launch a chain that is fully independent, is secure by btc hashrate, and you have all the tools you need to ICO, create your wallets, explorers, and so forth.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: We also have BaaS providers like Chainzilla.io that offer those types of services at a cost.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: If you have specific questions about tokenization or would like more information about paid blockchain services please write us at hello@chainzilla.io and we'll be happy to answer your questions.

Author: Nano#1742
Content: Hey do sidechains allow for smart contracts yet?

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Yes @Nano

Author: Nano#1742
Content: Really? So what is possible now?

Author: Nano#1742
Content: I own a startup that is looking to develop the ultimate platform for the tokenization of assets. Would this now be possible with komodo?

Author: Gordon Komodo#7477
Content: yes, I think that is possible with CCs

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes, CC can do it... but its still very new tech.

Author: Nano#1742
Content: What is CC?

Author: Gordon Komodo#7477
Content: KMD called it's smart contract CC - crypto condition

Author: Gordon Komodo#7477
Content: https://docs.komodoplatform.com/cc/index-book-jl.html

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: https://docs.komodoplatform.com/cc/contracts/index-contracts.html

Author: Nano#1742
Content: Are they written in solidity?

Author: Nano#1742
Content: Or easily converted from solidity?

Author: Gordon Komodo#7477
Content: CC contracts run native in C/C++ code

Author: Gordon Komodo#7477
Content: The team posted a bounty for solidity CC intepreter https://forum.komodoplatform.com/t/25000-kmd-bounty-for-cc-solidity-interpreter/174

Author: Gordon Komodo#7477
Content: so it might be easier to convert from solidity in the future

Author: Nano#1742
Content: Well that means that no one knows how to develop those smart contracts.

Author: Nano#1742
Content: Or a very small number of people for right now.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
Yes. These contracts don't work the same way as eth smart-contracts. For one, they aren't in the blockchain. They are in  the source code and are part of the consessus rules of any chain that runs them.
You can skim: https://komodoplatform.com/crypto-conditions-utxo-based-smart-contracts/ for a quick intro

Author: Nano#1742
Content: So they are like NEM smart contracts?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: I don't know much about NEM's smart contract implementation. But the website post I linked to has a good explanation of how Komodo's smart contracts work. Just skip the introductory parts

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: In broad strokes, any contract added will be in the source code, all the nodes will run the same software. Dapp developers will take advantage of RPC calls to use the contracts like Tokens.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: Tokens contract allows for onchain creation,tranfer and trade of tokens. Here are the RPC:https://docs.komodoplatform.com/cc/contracts/tokens/introduction.html

Author: Nano#1742
Content: Hmm alright.

Author: Nano#1742
Content: Well if I were to use komodo for my platform, I would want to collaborate with you guys directly to make sure I using Komodo to it's full potential.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: When you have time go through the links at https://docs.komodoplatform.com/home-cc.html it will give you a fair understanding on the current state and future direction of contracts on our platform. You can always stop by in #cc-general . If any of the existing contracts aren't enough to satisfy your need, you (or someone from your team) can submit a PR to repo with the additional features. https://docs.komodoplatform.com/cc/index-book-jl.html has almost all the info for a develo[er to get started writing CC. Currently writing in C++ is a straightforward process. Support for other languages might come in the future. You can always talk to @jl777c about any questions related to adding a new contract or modifying an existing one. The Tokens contract appears to have all the necessary features and it is augmented by the Gateways contract, which is similar to Blockstream's Liquid.

Author: Nano#1742
Content: Alright sounds good.
